item.title: Week 01 Inclass
item.description: First Class: September 12, 2018 Agenda Go Over Syllabus Discuss RStudio and Git Survey Practice using Git. Syllabus We will focus first on the syllabus and make sure all students are clear on what this course is and is not. Also we will consider what you can expect to obtain by taking this course. You will need access to the syllabus: On Course Site PHP 1560 Canvas PHP 2560 Canvas Github Site Discuss RStudio and Git We will discuss the three main uses of material in this course:

item.title: Week 04 Inclass
item.description: Fourth Class: October 3, 2018 Agenda Questions Discuss Preclass work In Class Project DO NOT DO ANYTHING BELOW BEFORE I GIVE INSTRUCTIONS Have one Person in your group click on this link and create a group and name that group. All other members can then click on the link and join the appropriate group. In Class Exercise bubblesort <- function(x) { if (length(x) < 2) return (x) for(last in length(x):2) { for(first in 1:(last - 1)) { if(x[first] > x[first + 1]) { save <- x[first] x[first] <- x[first + 1] x[first + 1] <- save } } } return (x) }

item.title: Week 07 Inclass
item.description: Seventh Class: October 24, 2018 Agenda Questions DO NOT DO ANYTHING BELOW BEFORE I GIVE INSTRUCTIONS Have one Person in your group click on this link and create a group and name that group. All other members can then click on the link and join the appropriate group. Please click in order to get your github repository with the assignment and starter code. You will not turn anything in but by Friday, October 25 at 11:59pm you will no longer be able to commit.

item.title: Week 08 Inclass

You can still work together. Please click in order to get your github repository with the assignment and starter code. You will not turn anything in but by Friday, November 2 at 11:59pm you will no longer be able to commit.

item.title: Week 09 Inclass
item.description: Class 9: November 7, 2018 Agenda Questions Project This project will be a multiweek project that is due on Wednesday, November 28, 2018 at 9am. This project will consist of the following: Data Scraping Text mining Graphics Reproducible research More details follow below: Day 1: Data Scraping (November 7, 2018) Find a topic that everyone in your group is interested in. Then try to find data which you can scrape with that.
